data.title: James J. Cronin
data.meta_description: James Cronin advises companies on how to protect their intellectual property rights and avoid infringing the rights of others. A registered patent attorney, he prepares and prosecutes patent applications for mechanical and electro-mechanical inventions and counsels on patent infringement and other aspects of intellectual property protection.
data.text:
Experience

James manages the international patent portfolios of multinational corporations in the commercial vehicle and cannabis industries.

He has recently helped multiple start-up companies with their patent filing and licensing strategies for new consumer products, building designs, and exercise machines.

James negotiates joint development and license agreements for large companies working with emerging technology companies.

He manages trademark portfolios for major brand owners in fields including hardscape products, golf instruction, financial services, healthcare services, and metal processing and fabrication.

James prepares and prosecutes U.S. and foreign patent applications for technologies including commercial vehicle brake and suspension systems, internal combustion engines, automotive parts, railcar equipment, agricultural machinery, laboratory equipment, surgical tools, sporting goods, and vape devices.

He volunteers for pro bono cases from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's Patent Pro Bono Program and Kansas City Volunteer Lawyers & Accountants for the Arts. While at the University of Kansas, James led a team that designed and manufactured a formula style race car suspension for the 2003 Jayhawk Motorsports Formula SAE Team.
